abstract: Ackquille Pollard, rising rap star better known as Bobby Shmurda, has yet to receive aid from Epic Records while in jail on gang conspiracy and gun charges; recently signed seven-figure deal with label on strength of his street credibility and viral hit, but it has neglected to offer legal aid or pay his $2 million bail; insiders say case marks departure from old days when labels were deeply protective of rap talent, highlighting corporate shift in industry.
lead_paragraph: Ackquille Pollard, who performs as Bobby Shmurda and was signed to Epic Records, found his label would not help him after his arrest.

headline.main: Street Image Helps a Young Rapper, Until It Doesn’t
headline.print_headline: Street Image Helps Young Rapper, Till It Doesn’t
headline.seo: Hip-Hop Star Bobby Shmurda, in Jail, Finds His Label Unsupportive

snippet: Ackquille Pollard, who performs as Bobby Shmurda and was signed to Epic Records, found his label would not help him after his arrest.
